plugins.name: Remove and select next
plugins.description:
üòü FIGMA NATIVE BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer triggers a global deselect.

Consequently, you need to take your mouse to select the next layer you want to work on.


ü•≥ PLUGIN BEHAVIOR

-> Removing a layer select the next layer.

Meaning you don't need to take your mouse back and you can continue to design at the speed of light on your keyboard!


‚å®Ô∏è KEYBOARD SHORTCUT

Plugins can't have keyboard shortcuts so you'll have to set it on your own.

See this page for a tutorial on macOS native keyboard shortcuts and BetterTouchTools
plugins.tagline: Remove layers without leaving your keyboard

plugins.name: K Translation
plugins.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
plugins.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

103740.name: K Translation
103740.description:
K Translation is a localization tool designed to simplify the process of translating your Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files.


After installing the plugin, the user uploads an XLIFF file containing translations. The plugin analyzes the file, determines the source language, and lists available target languages.


The user then selects which languages to translate the frame into. To begin the translation, simply select a frame in Figma that contains text elements.


Once the "Create copy" button is pressed, the plugin automatically scans all the text within the frame and creates copies of the frame for each selected target language, effectively localizing your design with just a few click.
103740.release_notes: Added the ability to download a file containing texts that were not translated.
103740.tagline: K Translation: localize Figma frames into multiple languages using XLIFF files in just a few clicks.

ÈÅ∏Êäû„Åó„Åü„ÉÜ„Ç≠„Çπ„Éà„ÇíÊåáÂÆö„Åó„ÅüÊØîÁéá„Åß1ÊñáÂ≠ó„Åö„Å§Êã°Â§ßÔºèÁ∏ÆÂ∞è„Åó„Åæ„Åô„ÄÇ

plugins.name: comodo exporter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you rename and export layers named $IMG in your Figma project based on special tags. You can choose between two workflows:

  1. Destructive export: Layers are renamed and export settings applied (JPG, PNG, SVG, @1x, @2x, @3x). Once renamed, the original $IMG layers are lost, and the plugin cannot be rerun unless you revert to an earlier version.
  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

A Figma template will soon be provided with pre-set tags and an organized layout to make your workflow faster and more reliable. More detailed documentation will also follow.
plugins.tagline: Rename & export $IMG layers via tags. Template & docs coming soon for easy setup.

  2. Non-destructive export: The plugin creates a new page where it duplicates and renames all matching layers, preserving the original ones. You can delete the new page and restart anytime.

plugins.name: Typemaker ‚Äî Design your font, live in Figma
plugins.description:
Transform your Figma designs into downloadable TTF fonts! Typemaker streamlines the process of creating custom fonts directly within your design workflow.


üé® Key Features:

‚Ä¢Automatically generates frames for all characters (A-Z, a-z, 0-9, symbols)

‚Ä¢Draw your glyphs directly in Figma using any design tool

‚Ä¢Built-in alignment guides for typographic consistency

‚Ä¢Visibility controls to organize your workspace

‚Ä¢Direct export to professional TTF format


‚ö°How it works:

1‚Ä¢Click "Create Glyph Frames" to generate the character grid

2‚Ä¢Design your glyphs inside the frames using shapes, pen tool, or imported SVGs

3‚Ä¢Customize font name and family

4‚Ä¢Download your ready-to-install TTF font


üîß Perfect for:

‚Ä¢Graphic designers creating original typefaces

‚Ä¢Branding projects requiring custom typography

‚Ä¢Rapid prototyping of typographic concepts

‚Ä¢Educational projects and creative experimentation


Start creating your custom typography today!
plugins.tagline: Create custom TTF fonts directly in Figma! Draw glyphs, export professional fonts instantly.

üîç Heuristic Check ‚Äî Usability feedback against Nielsen's 10 principles

Select a frame ‚Üí get ranked issues with specific fixes


üìä Quick Poll ‚Äî Stakeholder sign-off in minutes

Select 2-4 frames ‚Üí Generate link ‚Üí teammates vote/comment (no Figma login required)

üéØ Actionable Insights: Specific fixes, not vague opinions.

üîÅ Iteration-Friendly: Tweak, test, and ship with confidence.

Ready to design with confidence?

plugins.name: Design2Dev
plugins.description:
Design2Dev is a Figma plugin that extracts detailed design specs and generates structured AI prompts for React Native. Map custom UIs to design systems, export specs as JSON, and get production-ready code from ChatGPT, Claude, or Cursor ‚Äî no guesswork, just clarity.


Description:

Design2Dev bridges the gap between your polished Figma designs and AI-generated React‚ÄØNative code. No more guess-and-check with plain-language prompts‚Äîthis plugin produces developer-grade output in seconds:


  1. Extract design specs ‚Äì Build a full JSON mapping of component hierarchy, styles (colours, typography, spacing), layout properties, and design tokens.
  2. Map to UI libraries ‚Äì Auto-align designs with React Native Paper or other design systems.
  3. Generate AI prompts ‚Äì Output prompt-ready TXT files formatted to work effortlessly with ChatGPT, Claude, Cursor, Gemini, etc.
  4. Export visuals and specs ‚Äì Export PNG snapshots of selected frames, and JSON + TXT bundles‚Äîready for automated workflows or human inspection.
  5. Designed for speed ‚Äì Perfect for solo designers/devs needing accurate code now, not later. No least-common-denominator outputs‚Äîjust intention-preserving handoffs.


Ideal For:

  1. Designers shipping React Native apps today
  2. Developers optimizing prompt engineering from visuals
  3. Teams wanting clean spec-to-code pipelines before Figma or Bolt catch up
plugins.tagline: Turn Figma Designs into AI-Ready Code Prompts. Instantly.

Ideal For:

plugins.name: Design to System
plugins.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system ‚Äî effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. üîç Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. üìå Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. üéØ Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements ‚Äî ensuring consistency and systemization.
plugins.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system ‚Äì automatically.

136167.name: Design to System
136167.description:
Design to System is a Figma plugin that helps you convert your existing designs into a structured design system ‚Äî effortlessly.

With just a few clicks, you can extract styles from your design, register them as local styles, and reapply them consistently across your file.


Key Features

  1. üîç Analyze Selection : Extracts all design style properties (colors, text styles, shadows) from the selected layers. Color values are automatically categorized into background, text, and stroke styles for easier organization.
  2. üìå Register Styles : Registers the extracted styles into your Figma local styles panel. This enables consistent reuse and supports design system creation.
  3. üéØ Apply Styles : Applies the registered local styles back to the selected design elements ‚Äî ensuring consistency and systemization.
136167.tagline: Turn your designs into a reusable system ‚Äì automatically.

plugins.name: Awesome Bulk Metadata Importer
plugins.description:
Have you ever tried to add extra documentation to your Figma components, looking or better parity with your code or docs site? With this plugin, you can better utilize the Assets menu by searching components or icons by description or keywords.


This plugin checks a JSON file, and updates the alt text/description, synonym keywords, and link for all components and variants. Run this 1x for your entire library and stop wasting time manually updating metadata!


Sample CSV and JSON template
plugins.tagline: Bulk update your component descriptions, keywords, and docs link

plugins.name: Content Magic Filler with OpenAI
plugins.description:
1. Select one or more layers in your Figma file (the plugin will find all text layers within your selection).
  2. Open the plugin and enter your OpenAI API key. If you don't have one: https://help.openai.com/en/articles/4936850-where-do-i-find-my-openai-api-key
  3. Type a prompt or instruction describing the kind of text you want (e.g., ‚ÄúUS zip code‚Äù, ‚Äúcompany name‚Äù, ‚Äúcity in Japan‚Äù).
  4. Click "Generate Text". Each selected text layer will be filled with a unique, AI-generated response matching your instruction.
plugins.tagline: Instantly fill your Figma text layers with smart, unique AI-generated content.

plugins.name: Motionmill
plugins.description:
Prepare Your Figma File for Development with This Plugin


This Figma plugin helps you set up a well-organized and developer-friendly design file from the start. It allows you to quickly define and document your color palette and typography styles‚Äîboth as Figma styles and directly within the design file.


By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes‚Äîall clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.
plugins.tagline: Colors and Typography for Motionmill

By standardizing colors and text styles early in the process, you create a solid foundation for a consistent visual identity and a smoother handoff to development. Developers can easily reference the documented styles and convert them into design tokens or variables in code (e.g., CSS variables or a design system setup). This includes font families, sizes, line heights, and color codes‚Äîall clearly named and structured.


This plugin is perfect for teams looking to streamline collaboration between design and development. It saves time, reduces confusion, and ensures consistency throughout the project.

plugins.name: LayAuto Plugin

plugins.name: View Jumper
plugins.description: View Jumper helps designers quickly navigate large Figma files by creating visual bookmarks. Users set two key locations (View A and View B) that they need to reference frequently, then instantly teleport between them with preserved zoom levels and page context. Whether using the UI buttons, menu commands, or keyboard shortcuts, this plugin eliminates the frustration of constantly scrolling and searching through complex designs, making workflow significantly more efficient when comparing or referencing different areas.

accepted.name: Christopher
accepted.description:
Product Design @ heyo.is
Brand Design @ MARKoftheBRAND.com

plugins.tagline: Set viewpoints A & B. Teleport between design locations with a click.

plugins.name: LocalizeBuddy
plugins.description:
üåè Introducing LocalizeBuddy for Figma ‚Äî Your Ultimate i18n Export Companion!


LocalizeBuddy automatically extracts every text layer from your Figma file and converts it into clean, structured JSON‚Äîperfectly formatted for any localization pipeline. Skip the tedious copy-and-paste: design and ship faster with truly seamless internationalization. ‚ú®


Standout Features:


üîç Comprehensive Text Discovery

Auto-detects every text node, even deep inside groups, components, and nested frames.


üîë Smart Key Mapping

Auto-generate consistent, position-based keys that mirror your design hierarchy‚Äîe.g. page1.frame2.text3‚Äîso every JSON entry is predictably unique without relying on layer-name transformations.


üìÇ Structured JSON Output

Preserve your art-board and frame hierarchy in the output to keep context clear for translators.


üñºÔ∏è Frame-Only Export

Export the selected frame in one click‚Äîideal for precise, frame-level JSON extraction.

accepted.name: Alvin Bellero
accepted.description: Crafting code and building dreams, one line at a time üë®üèª‚Äçüíªü§ûüöÄ

plugins.tagline: Effortless export Figma text layers as structured JSON in one click‚Äîinstantly accelerate i18n setup!

plugins.name: CTRLFRK:GRAD
plugins.description:
GRAD gives you unprecedented control over colour transitions through the power of Bezier curves. This sophisticated plugin brings laboratory-grade precision to your gradient work through highly-customisable curves. Manipulate how colours blend across HSB components, visualise transitions in real-time, and achieve interpolation paths that were previously impossible. Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.


  1. Create expressive colour gradients with precise Bezier curve control
  2. Independently manipulate hue, saturation, and brightness curves for nuanced transitions
  3. Apply preset curves (ease-in, ease-out, S-curves) for common gradient effects
  4. Visualise and fine-tune with an interactive interface
  5. Generate exact colour stops based on mathematical interpolation
  6. Apply gradients directly to selected objects or create new gradient rectangles
plugins.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

Perfect for brand work, illustrations, and UI design where colour transitions matter.

132857.tagline: Precision gradient control for the colour obsessed

plugins.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
plugins.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like ‚ÄúRectangle 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúText 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúFrame,‚Äù or ‚ÄúGroup.‚Äù It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

‚Ä¢Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

‚Ä¢Large text (‚â• 18px or ‚â• 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.
plugins.tagline: Automate. Validate. Elevate.

127028.name: Quanta Symphony Design Review
127028.description:
The Automated Design Review Checklist ensures that UI/UX designs maintain high standards of organization, accessibility, layout, and content quality. It systematically evaluates design files to identify potential issues and improve usability.


In terms of Layer Organization, it checks for clear and descriptive layer names, flagging defaults like ‚ÄúRectangle 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúText 1,‚Äù ‚ÄúFrame,‚Äù or ‚ÄúGroup.‚Äù It also detects hidden layers, ensures layers used as masks are correctly applied, and verifies the presence of effects to maintain design consistency.


For Accessibility, the checklist validates text contrast ratios against WCAG 2.1 standards to ensure readability:

‚Ä¢Regular text (< 18px) must have a minimum contrast ratio of 4.5:1.

‚Ä¢Large text (‚â• 18px or ‚â• 14px bold) should meet a minimum contrast ratio of 3:1.

It also warns if text size is below 14px, flags elements smaller than 24x24px (as they might be too small for touch targets), and checks for opacity settings that could impact visibility.


The Layout Review identifies problematic scale constraints that could cause resizing issues and evaluates layer dimensions to ensure usability across different screen sizes.


In terms of Content, the system detects empty text layers that may indicate missing information and checks text properties to maintain proper styling, readability, and hierarchy.


By automating these design checks, this system helps designers streamline their workflow, ensuring consistency, accessibility, and overall design quality before final delivery.

networkAccess.reasoning: The plugin needs to access external resources for WCAG contrast checking and design pattern validation.

plugins.name: Outset Pr Invoice Plugin
plugins.description:
Invoice Filler Plugin for Outset PR


This plugin is specifically designed for Outset PR and works exclusively with their internal invoice template in Figma. It automates the process of populating the template with data submitted via the plugin‚Äôs form, streamlining the invoicing workflow for the company.


How It Works:


The plugin is built to integrate with a single invoice template used by Outset PR.

Users submit invoice data through the plugin's form.

The plugin then automatically fills the predefined fields in the Outset PR invoice template within Figma.


Limitation for Reviewers:


Since the plugin is tailored for Outset PR's proprietary invoice template, reviewers will not have access to the template for testing.


For Figma Reviewers:


To review the functionality of the plugin, please use mock data in the form. The plugin will generate a dummy page with the entered data displayed.

If you are a member of the Figma team, please fill out the form and review the data generated by the plugin to understand its intended functionality.


Key Features:


Specifically designed for Outset PR‚Äôs invoice template, allowing users to quickly populate the template with the required data.

Simplifies the invoicing process for Outset PR by eliminating manual data entry.

Optimized for seamless integration with a single internal template used by the company.
plugins.tagline: A plugin to fill invoices

130871.description:

If you are a member of the Figma team, please fill out the form and review the data generated by the plugin to understand its intended functionality.


Key Features:

plugins.name: Diopter
plugins.description:
This plugin helps you see how you are using remote components for linked and unlinked libraries. For example, you can find mobile components in a file with only desktop explorations. With a tool like this, you can being spring cleaning now and get your files squeaky clean.


To use this plugin, you'll need to create a personal access token with read-only access to files. I needed that token to be able to get details about file libraries‚Äîe.g., library name. The first time you run the plugin, you'll be asked to paste the token.
plugins.tagline: Clearly see which components you're using and where they come from.

127509.description:

plugins.name: Scribe Guard - AI-powered Writing System Validator
plugins.description:
üéØ What is it?

A powerful AI tool that analyzes your text content against your writing system guidelines, ensuring perfect brand consistency and tone of voice alignment.


‚ú® Key Features

  1. AI-powered content analysis
  2. Writing system validation
  3. Style guide compliance checks
  4. Tone of voice verification
  5. Terminology consistency
  6. Real-time feedback


üöÄ How to Use

  1. Upload your Writing System PDF
  2. Enter your ChatGPT API key
  3. Click "Analyze Copy"
  4. Review the detailed analysis


üõ†Ô∏è What You'll Need

  1. ChatGPT API key
  2. Your writing system guidelines in PDF


üîí Security Note

Your API key is handled securely and can be saved locally for convenience. All communications are encrypted and only happen through authorized channels.



The tool provides detailed feedback on tone, terminology, and style compliance, helping you maintain perfect brand consistency across all your content. No more manual checking - let AI do the heavy lifting! ‚ú®
plugins.tagline: Validate your text content against writing system guidelines with AI-powered analysis
